meta.source: Full call with Zoe (Puck venue owner)

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Business over personal issues and circumstances, no matter how grave they are...

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: I haven't had any correspondence whatsoever with the Fringe in terms of emails. I haven't been told that they're taking over your company.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: We're having to do a lot more than we thought we would…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: If you’re taking over a vulnerable person’s company… my company is based on my acts being happy.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: I totally agree with you… but that’s where there’s disparity.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: They told me they are responsible… That’s all I knew up until today.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: You don’t have to justify anything to me. I’d hate you to lose your reputation.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I said there would be a brochure. I didn’t know what to put in it when the Fringe weren’t getting back to me...

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: I think you just have to run your company. From the Fringe aspect, they're not trying to take over your company. They’re trying to ease your load.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: They haven’t spoken to me since May the second... apart from just: we’re taking over due to you being vulnerable. That’s all I’ve had.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: They told me I was vulnerable. I didn’t tell them I was. They made that up... The whole thing's fucked.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: If there’s any way that you can look at what you had agreed to give the acts…

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: That would be a good place to start. Some of the acts already aren’t playing anymore. You can’t do anything about those shows…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I’ve got the camera... I could get that set up. So there’s not gonna be any shows for a few days.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I assumed the Fringe would be apologising and rectifying the chaos they created... But no. They’ve told me nothing. Just let Half a Camel die at the hands of them.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Like I said, you can still claw it back.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Yeah, I can. I can now... because I now know what the acts are thinking.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I’m not the spokesperson for the acts, you know.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Brighton Fringe created that and gave me no plan, like… it was just a statement, no plan going forward…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: …at the same time, I had PC Dixon working with Alanna…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: …I now have to sort out my business… just knowing what it is I’m dealing with…

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: I don’t know if you want to talk to all your other venues… they might have more insight…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Yeah… yeah.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Everything that’s happening that’s negative — this needn’t be one of them.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: If it can be rectified… then okay, it’s not wrong anymore.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: That would be my main priority… just getting this sort of… this weekend’s done.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: The beginning of the shows was this weekend?

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Them taking over… like, the weekends are the big ones.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I think it was Thursday that we were told.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: I’ve been doing online tutorials at uni… meeting at the care home… comedy as well.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: If I was allowed… and they hadn’t been cooperating with fucking my ex…

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: They knew that. I asked them plenty of times — have you had any communication with my abuser?

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Yeah… that sounds really weird. I don’t understand that.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: I’ve now had confirmation from an act… they’re talking about separating me as if it’s a civil matter.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Yeah, but… thank you. I just honestly… haven’t been told anything. I don’t know what’s going on.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: If you can make your acts happy, even though technically the Fringe has taken over the shows, they’re still your acts.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: They haven’t talked… They’ve told me I’m vulnerable… no plan… I just thought all liability, all refunds, any complaints would be done by them.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Alan is now abusing me again… I’m trying to gauge what to prioritise.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Well, I would say you said you've got a handle on the other stuff… prioritize your business and damage limitations.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Yeah, I’m gonna have to.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: You almost don’t need to think about the Fringe. It’s all about Half a Camel.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: If artists are angry, what do you do? You try to solve the problems.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Because you want their repeat business, for example.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: They’re mainly angry from what they’ve said about the filming that isn’t happening.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: You don’t have to think about everything at once… just make Half a Camel a little bit happier.

lines.speaker: Zoe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Zoe / Ben
lines.text: Zoe urges focus on the acts; Ben expresses regret and confusion, confirms he was unaware of operational status.

lines.speaker: Zoe / Ben
lines.text: Zoe invites Ben to do what he feels necessary; Ben explains how he believed the company had been taken and that all refunds were now Fringe responsibility.

lines.speaker: Ben / Zoe
lines.text: Ben reaffirms legal intention to hold the Fringe accountable. Zoe insists Fringe cannot take the company.

lines.speaker: Ben
lines.text: Ben outlines a formal legal framework for the case: 'I will be stepping back in… they breached every charity law… they’re in deep.'

lines.speaker: Zoe / Audience Member
lines.text: Live venue interaction occurs; Zoe juggles artist-facing work while continuing emotional support for Ben.

lines.speaker: Ben / Zoe
lines.text: Ben: 'They made the decision for me… I wasn’t allowed to operate.' Zoe reinforces that Half a Camel still exists. Ben affirms full court plan.

lines.speaker: Zoe / Ben
lines.text: Zoe: 'Take care. Concentrate on your business.' Ben: 'I now know what I’m dealing with.'
